subject: Theoretical Condensed Matter Physics
title: Theoretical Condensed Matter Physics (TUM, Module PH1001)
description: Symmetries and phases of condensed matter; phonons and response; electrons and transport (Bloch/Wannier, band theory, Hall effects); interacting electrons with screening and collective modes; superconductivity; quantum magnetism, Hubbard models, disorder/localization. Workload 300 h (90 h contact), 10 ECTS, winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Knolle, Johannes. Language: EN.

goals.title: Theoretical Condensed Matter – Module Overview
goals.description: Learner can describe structures and phases of condensed matter and apply key models for lattice vibrations, electron bands/transport, interacting electrons, superconductivity, magnetism, and disorder.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can describe structures and phases of condensed matter and apply key models for lattice vibrations, electron bands/transport, interacting electrons, superconductivity, magnetism, and disorder.

goals.title: Symmetries, Phases & Structure
goals.description: Learner can classify phases of matter, relate scattering/structure factors to atomic composition, and discuss structural transitions/defects.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can classify phases of matter, relate scattering/structure factors to atomic composition, and discuss structural transitions/defects.

goals.title: Phonons & Response
goals.description: Learner can derive phonon spectra and specific heat, use inelastic neutron scattering/dynamic structure factors, and apply linear response and fluctuation–dissipation.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can derive phonon spectra and specific heat, use inelastic neutron scattering/dynamic structure factors, and apply linear response and fluctuation–dissipation.

goals.title: Electrons, Bands & Transport
goals.description: Learner can apply Bloch theorem and Wannier functions, classify metals/insulators/para-/diamagnetism, analyze semiclassical dynamics, Bloch oscillations, Drude/Boltzmann transport, and quantum Hall effects.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can apply Bloch theorem and Wannier functions, classify metals/insulators/para-/diamagnetism, analyze semiclassical dynamics, Bloch oscillations, Drude/Boltzmann transport, and quantum Hall effects.

goals.title: Interacting Electrons & Screening
goals.description: Learner can set up many-body descriptions (second quantization), analyze electron gas/Lindhard function, Fermi liquid theory, HF, RPA, screening, and collective excitations.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can set up many-body descriptions (second quantization), analyze electron gas/Lindhard function, Fermi liquid theory, HF, RPA, screening, and collective excitations.

goals.title: Electron–Phonon & Superconductivity
goals.description: Learner can explain electron–phonon coupling and BCS theory of superconductivity, including collective modes.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can explain electron–phonon coupling and BCS theory of superconductivity, including collective modes.

goals.title: Quantum Magnetism, Hubbard & Disorder
goals.description: Learner can discuss quantum magnetism, Hubbard models (weak/strong coupling), and disorder/localization effects in condensed matter.
goals.descriptionEn: Learner can discuss quantum magnetism, Hubbard models (weak/strong coupling), and disorder/localization effects in condensed matter.

titleEn: Theoretical Condensed Matter Physics (TUM, Module PH1001)
descriptionEn: Symmetries and phases of condensed matter; phonons and response; electrons and transport (Bloch/Wannier, band theory, Hall effects); interacting electrons with screening and collective modes; superconductivity; quantum magnetism, Hubbard models, disorder/localization. Workload 300 h (90 h contact), 10 ECTS, winter term. Version 2025w responsible: Knolle, Johannes. Language: EN.
